Description: Large fragment of undyed cotton cloth, shaped during wearing. Outline roughly trapezoidal, with an extension in one corner. Fringes of two types, on two adjacent edges, the edge with the longer fringe being a selvedge. Remains of selvedge along edge opposite to the latter, selvedge also along inner edge of extension. Self-stripes of two thicknesses made by bunches of weft threads, some of stripes running right across the fragment - a series of 4 pyramid shapes formed by short self-stripes towards outer acute corner. Some simple weft picks also turning back on themselves, hence trapezoidal shaping.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), North Plaza Level 7
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
